definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: She stayed at home and looked after her mother yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 來日誥日她呆正在家裏照料她母親了。

sentences.english: Could you get me two tickets for tomorrow here?
sentences.chinese: 你能否在這兒賣給我兩張來日誥日的車票？

sentences.english: There will be a fine day tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 來日誥日將是一個好天。

sentences.english: Not at all. We'll meet our general manager tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 不客套，明天將來誥日帶你去見一下我們總經理。

sentences.english: If I had money tomorrow, I would buy an expensive car.
sentences.chinese: 假定來日誥日我有錢了，我便購一輛貴的汽車。

sentences.english: How about if we go tomorrow instead?
sentences.chinese: 我們改成明天未來誥日去怎麼樣？
我明天將來誥日和他謀面。

sentences.english: Yesterday his mother wore an elegant dress and went the party.
sentences.chinese: 來日誥日他母親脫着一件高雅的連衣裙往減進舞會了。

sentences.english: I hoped that we should spud in tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我們來日誥日能開鑽。

sentences.english: If it should rain tomorrow, the crops would be saved.
sentences.chinese: 要是來日誥日下雨，莊稼就獲救了。

sentences.english: I'd love to, but Ihave to get up early tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我是很想再喝一點，但我明天將來誥日得夙起。

sentences.english: That find will be through Mary tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 那本書來日誥日將被瑪麗帶來。

sentences.english: I'm afraid I couldn't give you an answer today.
sentences.chinese: 死怕我來日誥日沒有能回問您。
來日誥日清晨我沒有能正在裏裏嗎？
那將是更好的來日誥日。

sentences.english: Now drips the saliva, bags on sale, will become tomorrow the tear.
sentences.chinese: 如今流的哈喇子，將敗爲來日誥日的眼淚。

definition: (history) to have an audience with the Emperor
posthumous name or title/to confer a posthumous title
records/book/Taoist written charm/book of prophecy (e.g. of dynastic fortunes)
to engrave (on wood or stone)/to inscribe
belly/skin/to state/to pass on information/to display
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
